text: Wesley Willis (May 31, 1963 â€“ August 21, 2003) was an American singer- songwriter and visual artist from Chicago. Willis began a career as an underground singer-songwriter in the outsider music tradition, with songs featuring his bizarre, humorous and often obscene lyrics sung over the auto accompaniment feature on his Technics KN electronic keyboard. On August 21, 2003, Willis died due to complications from chronic myelogenous leukemia in Skokie, Illinois. He was 40 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Wesley Willis Biography and MP3s at Alternative Tentacles * monzy.org Wesley Willis Biography including Wesley Willis Song Generator * Press release from Willis's good friend Jello Biafra in memory of Willis * Art of Wesley Willis , drawings by Willis of scenes in Chicago, as well as a sampling of his music. * Wesley Willis Art , drawings by Willis of scenes in Chicago * Loved Like a Milkshake A Wesley Willis tribute album by a variety of artists Category:1963 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:American singer-songwriters Category:People from Skokie, Illinois Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:Singers from Chicago
title: Wesley Willis
